lines.text: What's a rotten girl like you doing in a nice place like this?
Sometimes I suspect that you forget you're a member of Secret Intelligence Command. You're a SIC man.
Igor, you idiot, why must you listen to me when I'm WRONG?
The eyes of Goldfoot are upon you.
You know, Igor, I'm beginning to regret that I brought you back to life.
[Igor gets clobbered by one of Dr. Goldfoot's female robots]
I wish I was dead... *again*!
I declare! There's something about you that makes my little ol' heart go flippity, flippity! It's amazing.
And you're amazing. Mind if I sit down?
Reckon I'd swoom if you would... Mr. Armstrong.
No, no, my name is Gamble. Craig Gamble.
Aw, you're funning with me. I just know you're Todd Armstrong.
No, I tell you my name is Craig Gamble. I'm with Secret Intelligence Command. What's your name, beautiful?
Diane.
Is something in your eye?
Mmm hmm. Little ol' you. Reckon I'm taking care of you from now on, sweetie.
I already got a mother.
Silly boy, not like a mother.
A sister?
Keep talking.
What else is there?
You've reached voting age and you all don't know what else?

[Clears his throat]
Well, well I...
How would you like to kiss me? I just adore being kissed. In fact I'm just sensationable?
With the whole free world in an uproar, how could you sit in that office mooning over some *babe* you picked up in a cafeteria?
I resent you calling her a babe, Uncle Donald. She's a fine, upstanding girl - with character.
You didn't say anything about her character yesterday. All you were talking about was her legs!
What is your code number?

[beaming proudly]
Double-O and-a-half.

[mockingly]
"Double-O and-a-half." And you fancy yourself as a secret agent... Why, they won't even allow you to carry a gun, until you get a digit instead of a fraction!
Oh, that Number 11. I wish I had 12 of her!
Uncle Donald, well, at least can you give me your opinion?
YOU'RE NUTS!

[to Igor]
Stop dinging that dong!

[as he and Igor lead Craig and Todd to the dungeon]
The rooms I'm about to show you are the most interesting in my workshop. Oh, incidentally, these are some of my ancestors.

[Indicates various portrait paintings on the wall]
This was my great-grandfather - the most bloodthirsty pirate who was ever hung, drawn and quartered. And this one brought the terrors of the Inquisition to the peaceful villages of Carpathia - I like him! And this is Sandor the Slob. He was a Slav. He taught Attila the Hun everything he knew. Admirable character - strong family resemblance.

[as Igor is monitoring Diane's activity with Craig on a closed circuit TV screen]
Igor!
Yes, Dr. Goldfoot?
You bumbling idiot!
I did something wrong?
"Something wrong?" - you sent her to the wrong man, that's what you did wrong.
I did?
Yes! That's Craig Gamble, and he hasn't got a penny.
But Dr. Goldfoot, I thought...

"You thought" - that's just the trouble. You leave the thinking to me, and we'll be much better off. Ha! Creating a lovely creature like that to waste her... "ammunition" on a, on a *pauper*! Fie on you! You're an idiot!
You know, Igor, I'm beginning to regret that I brought you back to life.
Why?
You're inept. Obtuse. Uncouth. Unlettered. Ungrateful. Uncooperative. Uncouth...
You said "uncouth," Dr. Goldfoot.
...and unnecessary. But then, that's what I get for... digging up a gravedigger.
[pats Igor on the shoulder, as Igor hangs his head]
Why do you listen to me when I'm wrong?
